Berrien Community Foundation Hosts Backpacks For Good

Backpacks and School Supplies

The Berrien Community Foundation (BCF) is helping students get ready to learn this fall. BCF is hosting two backpack and school supply give away events in Niles this month for students who attend Niles and Brandywine Schools.

The events are:

Niles Community Schools Students: August 11, 5 -7 p.m. at Niles High School Parking Lot.

Brandywine Community Schools Students: August 20, 5 – 7 p.m. at Brandywine High School Parking Lot.

In addition to the backpacks and school supplies for kids in K-12, there will be a mobile food pantry at each event. Families will be able to drive up and select a backpack and be provided with food from The Feeding America Mobile Food Pantry.

The Niles/Brandywine backpack events are in partnership with the Frederick S. Upton Foundation.

The Niles Community Schools Facebook page is a forum for community discussion and we ask that community members observe the following guidelines:

2. No Abusive Speech: Profanity, threats, or bullying of any kind will not be tolerated.

3. No Promotions or Spam: Self-promotion, spam and irrelevant links aren't allowed.

Failure to observe these guidelines can be grounds for removal of comments and users from the page.

#VikingPride
